intro: Corysanthes leucotyle, commonly known as the white-flowered corysanthes, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, white, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. Corysanthes leucotyle is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in coastal environments.
